page.title: 01BERRINGTON "D" BLOCK
page.content: This is a{rural area,}based upon the {Parish of Berrington,}3 miles from the County town of{Shrewsbury.}Berrington village has only 12 houses and most of the people live on the{Cross Houses post war Council Estate. Recently some of these have been purchased by the tenants. Berrington is 1 mile off the main road at Cross Houses and still has the Church, the School and the Parish Hall. Both Berrington Post Office and Shop closed in the 70's and are now at Cross Houses. The physical separation between the original centre based at Berrington and the newer, larger centre at Cross Houses gives rise to some feelings of difference. {Brompton}hamlet is between Cross Houses and the{River Severn. Little recent development in the area has increased the problems associated with rural depopulation.
